title: Astronaut Training
details: Experience what it takes to become an astronaut with hands-on training exercises and simulations. This event offers a unique glimpse into the rigorous preparation required for space missions.

title: A Night Under the Stars
details: Spend an evening exploring the wonders of the California night sky with astronomers at Griffith Observatory. Guests will enjoy telescope viewing, guided constellation tours, and a special lecture on the future of deep-space observation.

title: Moon Landing Anniversary
details: Celebrate the anniversary of the first moon landing! This event will feature a live presentation on the Apollo missions, followed by a viewing of the moon through the observatory's telescopes. Attendees will also have the opportunity to participate in a Q&A session with space historians.

title: Journey Through the Cosmos
details: Learn about the formation of stars, the mysteries of black holes, and the future of space exploration. Suitable for students, educators, and space enthusiasts of all ages, this event aims to inspire and educate through the wonders of our universe.

title: Lunar Exploration
details: Join us for an in-depth look at the history and future of lunar exploration. This event will cover past missions to the moon, current lunar research, and upcoming missions planned by various space agencies. Participants will also get to see moon rocks and other lunar artifacts.

title: Moon Observation Night
details: Explore the lunar landscape and marvel at the beauty of the Moon. This event is suitable for all ages and promises an unforgettable experience under the moonlit sky.

title: The Moon's Mysteries
location: American Museum of Natural History, New York, NY
details: Explore the mysteries of the moon! This event will delve into the moon's formation, its phases, and its impact on Earth. The evening will conclude with a special planetarium show focusing on lunar phenomena.

title: Black Holes 101
location: U.S. Space & Rocket Center, Huntsville, AL
details: Dive into the mysterious world of black holes. Learn how they form, how scientists detect them, and what they teach us about the universe.

title: Journey to the Stars
details: An interactive lecture and workshop where participants learn about stellar evolution, from nebulae to supernovae.

title: Star Gazing at the Park
details: Participants will have the opportunity to explore the wonders of the night sky using high-quality telescopes. This event is perfect for both seasoned star gazers and newcomers alike, offering a chance to learn about constellations, planets, and other celestial phenomena.

title: Women in Space
location: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum, Washington, D.C.
details: Celebrate the contributions of women in space exploration at this inspiring event. Hear from female astronauts, engineers, and scientists about their experiences and achievements. The event will also feature a panel discussion on the future of women in space missions.

title: Rocky Mountain Space Innovators
location: Wings Over the Rockies Air & Space Museum, Denver, CO
details: Celebrate Colorado's role in the aerospace industry with talks from local startups, interactive exhibits, and networking with innovators shaping the future of space technology.

title: Meteor Shower Watching
details: Join us for an unforgettable night as we observe a spectacular meteor shower. This event offers a unique opportunity to witness a breathtaking display of shooting stars.

title: The Future of Space Tourism
details: Discover what the future holds for space tourism at this exciting event. Learn about the latest advancements in commercial space travel, upcoming tourist missions, and what it takes to prepare for a trip to space. Attendees will also get a virtual tour of a space hotel.

title: Mars Night: From Phobos to Perseverance
location: American Museum of Natural History, New York, NY
details: Short talks about Mars missions, followed by a Q&A session. Accessible, engaging, and beginner-friendly.

title: Exploring the Outer Planets
location: California Science Center, Los Angeles, CA
details: Take a journey to the outer planets! This event will cover the latest discoveries about Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune, including findings from recent missions like Juno and Cassini. Participants will have the opportunity to ask questions and engage in interactive displays.

title: Cosmic Art Festival
location: Monte Sano State Park, Huntsville, AL
details: An outdoor festival blending astronomy with the arts, including live music, space-inspired art installations, and telescope viewing stations.
